author: dlr
msg: WC merge info property handling refactoring.  No behavioral change.
* subversion/libsvn_wc/props.c
(combine_forked_mergeinfo_props): Return any error from
svn_mergeinfo__to_string() directly, rather than wrapping it with
the SVN_ERR() macro, then returning SVN_NO_ERROR.

author: epg
msg: In NFS v3 and under, the server doesn't track opened files.  If you
unlink(2) or rename(2) a file held open by another process *on the
same host*, that host's kernel typically renames the file to .nfsXXXX
and automatically deletes that when it's no longer open, but this
behavior is not required.
For obvious reasons, this does not work *across hosts*.  No one
knows about the opened file; not the server, and not the deleting
client.  So the file vanishes, and the reader gets stale NFS file
handle.  We have this problem with revprops/* and current.
* subversion/libsvn_fs_fs/fs_fs.c
(SVN_ESTALE_RETRY_COUNT, SVN_RETRY_ESTALE, SVN_IGNORE_ESTALE): New
macros for retrying opens and reads after ESTALE, and ignoring
ESTALE errors from close, within a loop of SVN_ESTALE_RETRY_COUNT
(10) iterations.  SVN_RETRY_ESTALE and SVN_IGNORE_ESTALE are defined
as SVN_ERR when ESTALE is not defined.
(read_current): New function for reading the current file using the
ESTALE macros.
(get_youngest, get_next_revision_ids): Use read_current.
(svn_fs_fs__revision_proplist): Use the ESTALE macros.

author: ehu
msg: Remove branch merged in r24466 and r24467.

author: dlr
msg: A follow-up to r24453, *really* fixing reporter behavioral
compatibility between pre-1.5 clients talking with 1.5+ repositories
(r24453 fixed only reporter *API* compatibility, not client/server
compat).
* subversion/libsvn_repos/reporter.c
(write_path_info): Default DEPTH to B->default_depth, still erroring
out if both are svn_depth_unknown.  Improve corresponding error
message.  Adjust doc string accordingly.
* subversion/mod_dav_svn/reports/update.c
(dav_svn__update_report): Don't expect a "depth" element.  Just
default to infinity, but set to svn_depth_files if "recursive=no".
Reset depth used for svn_repos_set_path3() and svn_repos_link_path3()
calls to default to unknown.
* subversion/libsvn_ra_svn/protocol
(update, switch, status, diff): Drop depth parameter from each
command.  These commands are all reporter driven; depth is
specified via the reporter's set-path and link-path sub-commands.
* subversion/svnserve/serve.c
(MAYBE_UNFOLD_TO_DEPTH): Remove macro (now unused).
(set_path, link_path): Default depth to svn_depth_unknown.  If depth
is not specified, libsvn_repos will end up using the depth
equivalent of the recurse flag read by accept_report().
(accept_report): Change DEPTH parameter to RECURSE.  Convert
parameter value to depth before passing it on to svn_repos__begin_report().
(update, switch_cmd, status, diff): Drop parsing of an optional depth
parameter, and pass the recurse parameter to accept_report()
instead of depth.
Patch by: me
kfogel
vgeorgescu

author: ehu
msg: * configure.in: Revert inadvertently committed change from r24466.
